cs.man.ac.uk.tree.nodes

Class Node

  • java.lang.Object
    • cs.man.ac.uk.tree.nodes.Node
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    LearningNode, SplitNode

    public class Node
extends java.lang.Object
    The basic tree node object.
    Author:
    Richard Kirkby (rkirkby@cs.waikato.ac.nz), Rob Lyon

    • Field Detail

      • observedClassDistribution

        protected DoubleVector observedClassDistribution
        The class distribution observed at this node. Each entry in the vector contains a count of examples observed of each class.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Node

        public Node(double[] classObservations)
        Default constructor.
        Parameters:
        classObservations - the distribution observed at the node.

    • Method Detail

      • getObservedClassDistribution

        public double[] getObservedClassDistribution()
        Returns:
        the observed class distribution.

      • getClassVotes

        public double[] getClassVotes(I_Instance inst,
                              GHVFDT ht)
        Gets the predictive votes for each class at this node, for the supplied instance. The votes are actually the counts of observed examples of each class. For example, [ 10, 50, 32 ] would correspond to 10 votes for class 0, 50 for class 1, and 32 for class 2.
        Parameters:
        inst - the data instance to obtain the predictive votes for.
        ht - the GHVFDT the node belongs to.
        Returns:
        the votes for each class as a double array.

      • isLeaf

        public boolean isLeaf()
        Returns:
        true if this is a leaf node, and not a learning node.

      • filterInstanceToLeaf

        public FoundNode filterInstanceToLeaf(I_Instance inst,
                                      SplitNode parent,
                                      int parentBranch)
        Passes the instance to a leaf node for classification. If this node is not a leaf node, it is passed down recursively.
        Parameters:
        inst - the instance to filter down.
        parent - the parent split node.
        parentBranch - the index of the node being deactivated, in the parent, corresponding to which branch of the parent it belongs to.
        Returns:
        the leaf node found.

      • observedClassDistributionIsPure

        public boolean observedClassDistributionIsPure()
        Returns:
        true if all examples observed by this node belong to a single class.
